column2: dplyr::group_by(trial, year, location, season, hybrid, technology, application) |>
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'trial', 'year', 'location', 'season', 'hybrid', 'technology'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
dplyr::select(trial, year, location, season, hybrid, technology, application, yld, sd_yld, n, sev) %>%
study_id = paste(trial, year, location, season, hybrid, sep = "_"),
drop_na(yi, sei)  # remover casos com NA em yi ou sei
